carousel_items: Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

clock.tip: Works faster on an empty stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydrochlorothiazide is a thiazide diuretic (water pill). It works in the kidneys to make you urinate more, which removes extra water and certain electrolytes. This lowers blood pressure and swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Hydrochlorothiazide is a well-tolerated water pill that's often the first-choice treatment for mild high blood pressure.
downsides: Doesn't work well in people with severe kidney problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't work well in people with severe kidney problems.

upsides: Works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people. Works especially well for African Americans.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Good option if you have both high blood pressure and heart failure.
Raises calcium levels in the body, so it can be good for people with osteoporosis to slow down bone loss and even help with new bone formation.
Most people have very few side effects.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.

Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Good option if you have both high blood pressure and heart failure.
Raises calcium levels in the body, so it can be good for people with osteoporosis to slow down bone loss and even help with new bone formation.
Most people have very few side effects.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure. Removes extra water from your body.

userStories.tip: I sometimes have pain in urethra

userStories.tip: take it early in the day or closer to when you can go to the bathroom.  long distance traveling and not near a bathroom can be a hassle if you wait.
take it in the morning, restrict afternoon caffeine

drugs.name: Hydrochlorothiazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Too much Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Hydrochlorothiazide. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Too much Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Hydrochlorothiazide. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Hydrochlorothiazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Hydrochlorothiazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

risks_warnings.title: Gout
risks_warnings.description: Hydrochlorothiazide can increase uric acid levels and cause or worsen gout. Uric acid levels may need to be monitored if you have gout.

description_processed.orig: Hydrochlorothiazide can increase uric acid levels and cause or worsen gout. Uric acid levels may need to be monitored if you have gout.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Vision changes can happen weeks to months of using Hydrochlorothiazide. Tell your doctor immediately about any vision changes or worsening.

description_processed.orig: Vision changes can happen weeks to months of using Hydrochlorothiazide. Tell your doctor immediately about any vision changes or worsening.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Losartan is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function like an ACE inhibitor, but with fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Similar to ACE inhibitors (like Lisinopril), with fewer side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.

Similar to ACE inhibitors (like Lisinopril), with fewer side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

userStories.tip: Don't skip the dose. Take right  away after you remember.
I don't want to take a higher dose but it seems to be losing its effect, but higher blood pressure is now o.k. according to the cardiologists in older people.

userStories.identifier: in excellent condition for my age I
userStories.tip: did develop a dry cough now and then  I didn't realize was losartin side effect. I took it as a much cheaper drug than one I was using which was similar. A 100 dollar difference a month. I tried the more expensive one and then switched back

If I had looked up the adverse side effects before taking it I would never have allowed myself to be put on it! I developed all of them. I felt like I was dying! Now I check out all medication before starting a new prescription!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Varied the times taking it to see if it changed my side effects:swelling below the knee. Stopped after two week when my shoes no longer fit.
Take the medication in the morning at the same time each day.
my physician halved the dose to deal with throat irritation/dry cough
userStories.identifier: fit, active executive with mild HBP

drugs.name: Losartan

off-label_indications.indication: Lower heart attack and stroke risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Losartan can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Losartan can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Taking Losartan can put you at risk for increased risk of developing or worsening liver function. Let your prescriber know if you have liver disease, including cirrhosis of the liver.

description_processed.orig: Taking Losartan can put you at risk for increased risk of developing or worsening liver function. Let your prescriber know if you have liver disease, including cirrhosis of the liver.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Losartan can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Losartan.

description_processed.orig: Losartan can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Losartan.
